body.head.byline: By HAEYOUN PARK and GRAHAM ROBERTS

block.p: Already stripped of much of its travertine cladding, Alice Tully Hall has shut down for an 18-month makeover led by the architects Diller Scofidio & Renfro. The renovation, the first major phase of a redevelopment project at Lincoln Center, involves replacing much of the travertine with glass to foster a sense of communication between the interior and the street. In the new incarnation, a glass-enclosed dance rehearsal studio of the Juilliard School will be visible just above a soaring three-story Alice Tully lobby.
